It seems you are well on your way to debugging the missing contstrants ;-)

The diag command gave you this ...
osgi> diag org.eclipse.core.runtime
initial@reference:file:C:/Program
Files/IBM/EclipseCache/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.2.0.v20060511.jar/
[2]
  Missing required bundle org.eclipse.core.jobs_[3.2.0,4.0.0).
  Missing required bundle org.eclipse.equinox.registry_[3.2.0,4.0.0).
  Missing required bundle org.eclipse.equinox.preferences_[3.2.0,4.0.0).
  Missing required bundle org.eclipse.core.contenttype_[3.2.0,4.0.0).
  Missing optionally required bundle
org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.auth_[3.2.0,4.0.0).

And the "ss" command told you that only the following bundles were installed:
osgi> ss

Framework is launched.

id      State       Bundle
0       ACTIVE      system.bundle_3.2.0.v20060510
1       ACTIVE      org.eclipse.equinox.common_3.2.0.v20060512
2       INSTALLED   org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.2.0.v20060511
3       ACTIVE      org.eclipse.update.configurator_3.2.0.v20060511

This indicates that the bootstrap code (EclipseStarter) was able to install the initial set of bundles.  But it looks like update.configurator did not do its job of installing the rest of the platform.  The core.runtime depends on many of the bundles that update.configurator should have installed.

I suggest you set the debug option for update.configurator in your debug options file:

org.eclipse.update.configurator/debug=true

If that does not give you any insite then you will need to debug update.configurator.  Start by placing a break point at the beginning of the activator's start method: 

org.eclipse.update.internal.configurator.ConfigurationActivator.start()

I suspect your configuration/setup is missing the necessary information needed by update.  Does your configuration/setup use features to describe the platform or do you have a preconfigured platform.xml or what?  This is getting out of the realm of the Equinox-Framework and into Platform->Update.

Ah ah... yes I was playing around with the standaloneUpdate from UM... this is very possible that I completly messed up the update config... :)
AHHHHHHH yeah... i may have destroyed the platform.xml.. ok... let me look around :) thanks for the hint :)
I will update today with my finding

darn, yeah eclipse -clean and changing the platform.xml helped...
Ok, I found the root cause but without having a little Tom in my pcket (or on the other side of the bugzilla) I would nevare have found it :)
I will close this one, thx
